example[1]: His body suddenly went limp and he fell down on the floor.
definition[1]: to walk slowly and with difficulty because one leg is hurt or injured
example[2]: Moreno limped off the field with a foot injury.
definition[2]: if a ship or aircraft limps somewhere, it goes there slowly, because it has been damaged
example[3]: The damaged liner limped into New York.
definition[3]: the way someone walks when they are limping
example[4]: Young walked with a slight limp.
